153.title: Wellness Services
153.description: Wellness Services are a part of Student Services, and are designed to provide support to students during their time at St. Lawrence College.

154.title: Accessibility Services
154.description: Our services and supports are provided to students with a temporary or permanent disability to ensure equal access at St. Lawrence College

155.title: Health Services
155.description: The Campus Health Centre has clinics on all three campuses and provides a wide range of in person and telemedicine health centre services through individualized and confidential medical health and wellness care.

156.title: Wellness Groups
156.description: In a group environment, Groups and Workshops for Wellness provide students support in building and maintaining a strong sense of well-being.

157.title: Events
157.description: Every academic year, Student Wellness & Accessibility holds transition events for all students with disabilities and functional limitations.

158.title: Forms & Guides
158.description: These forms and guides are used to help us provide our services at Student Wellness & Accessibility.

159.title: Spiritual Care Advisor
159.description: Spiritual health is about so much more than religion. Spirituality involves pursuing answers to key questions like: 'Who am I? Why am I here? What's the point?' It's the foundation of overall health and well-being.

160.title: Crisis and after Hours Support
160.description: In an emergency, call 911 or visit your nearest hospital emergency department. If you are experiencing mental or emotional distress, find resources for crisis support here.

161.title: Togetherall
161.description: A safe space to connect with peers online, to get things off your chest, explore your feelings, get creative and develop skills and strategies to support your mental health and well-being.

162.title: TAO
162.description: An online suite of tools with a mobile app designed to support your well-being by teaching life skills, building resilience, and encouraging positive growth. Whether you are struggling with relationship challenges, sadness, pain management, substance abuse, or other stressors, TAO empowers you to take charge of your life.

163.title: WeConnect
163.description: Contributes to a resilient student community by further augmenting existing on-campus mental health resources.

164.title: GuardMe Student Support Program
164.description: This program is designed to support your mental and emotional wellbeing, ensuring you have the tools and support you need to thrive at university/college.

165.title: The Learning Portal Wellness Hub
165.description: This hub will help you develop strategies to improve your overall well-being.

166.title: LGBTQQ2S+
166.description: The SLC Alliance is an educational, social, and supportive group for members of the 2SLGBTQIA+ community and their allies at St. Lawrence College.
